page.title: 06Congleton Cattle Market
page.content: It was opened in September 1964 on a site in the middle of town which is now occupied by the Police Station. It was moved in 1966 to its present site. The{Cattle Market}is open Tuesdays only and the auctioneers and proprietors are Whittaker and Biggs. At 10.30am. cows are auctioned, 12.30pm. bulls and sheep and at 1.00pm. beef cattle are auctioned. On average 250 sheep and 400 cattle are sold every week but this does vary with the time of the year. Most of the buyers and sellers come from an area within 30 miles but some do come from other parts of this country and Europe. During the rest of the week the Market is used as a bus depot and as a storage place for continental lorries.
